intro: Coccoloba micropunctata, commonly known as the dwarf buttonwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its small, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine, punctate markings. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, typically growing in moist, shaded environments. Coccoloba micropunctata is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid climates.
